etymologies: late 18th century; earliest use found in Asiatick Researches. From Sanskrit sundarī, use as noun of the feminine of sundara beautiful, handsome, variant of (earlier) sūnara handsome, ultimately from the Indo-European base of su- good + the Indo-European base of nṛ man, hero

definitions: Any of several tropical Asian trees of the genus Heritiera (family Malvaceae) which grow abundantly in India and yield a hard and durable timber; especially H. fomes and H. littoralis.
